definition: to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt

sentences.english: The number of corrupt officials fleeing China reflects the government's serious attitude about the crackdown on corruption.
sentences.chinese: 逃离中国的贪官数量反映了政府打击贪腐的严正态度。

sentences.english: He also says that the corruption charges against them are politically motivated.
sentences.chinese: 他并且表示，对他们的贪腐指控是出于政治动机。

sentences.english: Xie one month ago participated and assisted the investigation of corruption against the county's Deputy Secretary.
sentences.chinese: 谢一个月前参与协助查办该县副书记贪腐案。

sentences.english: SO4 Actions taken in response to incidents of corruption.
sentences.chinese: SO4对贪腐事件所采取的行动。

sentences.english: SO3 Percentage of employees trained in organization's anti-corruption policies and procedures.
sentences.chinese: SO3组织员工接受反贪腐政策训练的比例。

sentences.english: The influx of cash, and centralized power, has created opportunities for graft.
sentences.chinese: 现金的涌入与中央集权的权力制造了贪腐机会。

definition: corruption and abuse of the law (idiom); to take bribes and bend the law
buying and selling of official positions
(of an official) corrupt and negligent of his duty
to use one's position for personal gain (idiom)
grasping officials, corrupt mandarins (idiom); abuse and corruption
